title: Mark Carney, a prime minister seeking to free Canada from US dominance
subhead: As the international order weakens, the Canadian leader has moved on from the Trudeau era, when his predecessor was seen as naive on the world stage, and to assert himself against hegemonic powers – starting with his American neighbor.

title: French prosecutors to request Le Pen's election ban be upheld
Paris prosecutors raid French offices of Elon Musk's X
One month after Maduro's abduction in Venezuela, the transition of power is unclear
subhead: While Delcy Rodriguez, whom Donald Trump approved to replace Nicolas Maduro at the start of January, appears to be meeting Washington's expectations, it is still impossible to know whether this situation will open up space for democracy.

title: France's 2026 budget battle is finally over. The next one may be even more complex.
subhead: The Finance Ministry is already working on the next budget bill. On paper, France will need to make a deficit reduction effort twice as great as in 2026. It will be a daunting challenge, so close to the presidential election.

title: Comic books: After Angoulême, a new French festival shows promise
subhead: After the International Comic Book Festival's 53rd edition was canceled, in Angoulême, southwestern France, the Grand Off and Interconnected Comic Book Festivals, conducted in around 15 European cities, kept the art alive.

title: French NGOs mobilize to remove foxes from national list of pests
subhead: Every three years, the French government draws up a list of 'species likely to cause damage,' which allows these animals to be hunted year-round. NGOs and researchers have criticized the lack of scientific basis for the list, which includes the red fox.

title: Macron says France is working to resume contact with Putin

Gabriel Attal's challenge of breaking with Macron
SpaceX-xAI merger: Musk defends AI project in space as analysts question viability
Marine Le Pen's double life: Defendant during the week, party leader over the weekend
subhead: The leader of the French far right is waiting to find out whether her ban on running in elections will be upheld. From the Paris appeals court to the municipal election campaign, she wants to give the illusion that life goes on.

title: 'Architect of God' Antonio Gaudí could be beatified in Spain as anniversary of death approaches
subhead: The year 2026 will mark the consecration of Barcelona's basilica, the Sagrada Família, whose tallest tower is nearing completion and is expected to be inaugurated in June in the presence of Pope Leo XIV. For some of the faithful, the astonishing building stands as a testament to the extraordinary faith of its creator, whose beatification they are calling for.

title: Syria and Lebanon: The search for a fresh start since Assad's fall and Hezbollah's collapse
subhead: Beirut is seeking to build a relationship on equal footing with the new authorities in Damascus, but progress has remained slow. The weight of history, particularly Syria's tutelage over Lebanon from 1990 to 2005 and Hezbollah's involvement alongside the Assad regime from 2012 to 2024, has fueled mistrust.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'European countries have achieved unprecedented levels of prosperity and social well-being'
Environment: Europe's temptation to unravel hard-won progress, ignoring scientific truth
'A decline in birth rates could help France solve some of its most serious difficulties'
